intro: Dorstenia seretii, commonly known as the African mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It is a member of the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally twisted leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale purple, blooming in the early morning. Dorstenia seretii thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
